unnormalised: Real estate prices in Mumbai saw an avg. increase of 8% in Q3 2024, according to a recent report by Knight Frank India. The report highlights that property registrations in the city reached 25,000 units during the period, marking a significant surge compared to the same period last year. Experts attribute this growth to increased demand and favorable market conditions.
normalised: Real estate prices in Mumbai saw an average increase of eight percent in Q three two thousand and twenty four, according to a recent report by Knight Frank India. The report highlights that property registrations in the city reached twenty five thousand units during the period, marking a significant surge compared to the same period last year. Experts attribute this growth to increased demand and favorable market conditions.

unnormalised: Analyzing the data further, properties in South Mumbai commanded an avg. price of ₹45,000 per sq ft, while those in the western suburbs were priced at around Rs. 20,000/sq ft. The report also noted that 3BHK apartments were the most sought-after configuration, accounting for nearly 45% of total sales. Developers are increasingly focusing on launching projects in the affordable housing segment, with units priced between Rs. 50 lakh and ₹1.5 crore.
normalised: Analyzing the data further, properties in South Mumbai commanded an average price of rupee forty five thousand per square foot, while those in the western suburbs were priced at around rupee twenty thousand per square foot. The report also noted that three B-H-K apartments were the most sought-after configuration, accounting for nearly forty five percent of total sales. Developers are increasingly focusing on launching projects in the affordable housing segment, with units priced between rupee fifty lakh and rupee one point five crore.

unnormalised: For potential homebuyers, understanding these numbers is crucial. Factors like location, property type, and developer reputation play a significant role in determining the overall value. Consulting with a real estate advisor is recommended to make informed decisions and navigate the complexities of the property market. Furthermore, keeping an eye on interest rates and government policies can help buyers time their purchases effectively.
